question: Which country is set to launch a remote-sensing satellite named Arktika-M, to monitor Arctic climate and environment?
explanation:
As per the recent announcement from a Russian aerospace company, Russia is set to launch the first Arktika-M satellite to monitor Arctic climate and environment.
The first edition of the satellite has been developed and it has been prepared for launch this year while the second satellite would be launched in 2023. The remote-sensing satellite Artika-M is expected to monitor the meteorological conditions of the polar region of the earth and assist in accurate weather forecasting.
